title: Updated NFL Power Rankings: New 1-32 poll, plus each team's rookie of the year
content: There was plenty of movement after a wild Week 16. We also looked at the best rookies from all 32 teams.

title: Sources: NBA eyes new ways to combat tanking
content: The NBA has begun to gather input from its owners and GMs on new ways to combat tanking, sources told ESPN.

title: Four teams boast six players each for Pro Bowl
content: The Ravens, Broncos, 49ers and Seahawks each led the way with six players each selected for the Pro Bowl Games, announced Tuesday.

title: Ex-Michigan OC still faces aggravated ID theft
content: A federal judge has denied a motion by ex-Michigan co-OC and QBs coach Matt Weiss to have 10 aggravated identity theft counts against him dismissed in a case where he is charged with hacking into computers to steal students' videos and photos.

title: Purdy authors 'close to a perfect game' with 5 TDs
content: With 44-year-old Colts quarterback Philip Rivers and his comeback occupying most of the headlines entering Monday's game, it was Brock Purdy who stole the show, throwing five touchdown passes in leading San Francisco to a 48-27 win at Lucas Oil Stadium.

title: Rivers turns back clock but can't will Colts to win
content: Newly unretired Philip Rivers turned in an impressive individual performance Monday night that saw him throw for 277 yards and two touchdowns. But it wasn't enough to deliver the Colts a win against the 49ers as Indianapolis saw its playoff hopes fade.

title: Green leaves court after heated exchange with Kerr
content: Warriors coach Steve Kerr and forward Draymond Green got into a heated argument during a third-quarter timeout Monday night, causing Green to leave the bench and miss the final 20 minutes of a 120-97 win over the Magic.

title: Self: Family wants Peterson near 100% for return
content: Kansas coach Bill Self said Monday night that Darryn Peterson's family does not want the projected No. 1 pick to return from injury until he is "as close to 100 percent as possible."

title: Pacers hope NBA looks at play that injured Jackson
content: Indiana Pacers coach Rick Carlisle wants the NBA to look at a play in the first quarter where he says Boston Celtics center Neemias Queta elbowed Isaiah Jackson twice, forcing the forward out of his team's 103-95 loss as he was evaluated for a concussion.

title: Kiyan Anthony is stepping out of his dad's shadow -- and into his own spotlight
content: His decision to play for Syracuse felt like a coronation. Now, he's out to prove he's more than Carmelo's son.

title: A 12-player blockbuster? Cy Young signings? Ranking the biggest MLB Christmas week moves
content: Who says the baseball offseason slows down for the holidays? Let's remember some free agent signings and trades.

title: Aggrieved fan index: The 10 fan bases in 2025 that have the right to be most frustrated
content: Who has reason for jeer this holiday season? We break down which teams' fans have the most reasons to be mad.

title: 'I love it and hate it': Miracles, nightmares and more tales of NBA Christmas
content: With NBA Christmas games on the horizon, stars and coaches share their stories and gripes about playing on the holiday.

title: Men's: UConn supplants Duke as fourth No. 1 seed
content: The Huskies return to the top line as Duke drops to a 2-seed after suffering its first loss of the season.

title: Women's: Louisville up, Tennessee down as the battle to host heats up
content: A decisive win over Tennessee put Louisville solidly inside the top 16 -- and dropped the Lady Vols to a 6-seed.

title: Why and when the WNBPA executive committee might vote to strike
content: How and when would the WNBPA executive committee vote to strike? What would that entail? What benefits would be lost?

title: Chelsea are using Strasbourg as a "farm team" -- is this the new blueprint for top clubs?
content: Strasbourg now exists as a training ground for Chelsea prospects, akin to baseball's farm system. Is this the future of European soccer?

title: Overreactions: Are Villa in the title race? Can Wolves avoid history?
content: Just before we hit the crowded festive fixtures, we have plenty to overreact to in the Premier League.

title: World Junior Championship guide: Top contenders, key players to watch
content: The tournament starts Thursday, with the best under-20 players in hockey. Here are gold medal favorites, players set to break out.

title: The NHL's best this week: Is Craig Berube on the hot seat in Toronto?
content: As the holiday break approaches, the Maple Leafs aren't exactly excelling. Plus, key games in the week ahead.

title: Buzz: Purdy, McCaffrey and Kittle deliver big 'Monday Night Football' performances
content: Brock Purdy and Christian McCaffrey deliver top-10 scores for the week, Kittle the top tight end but leaves early.

title: Free agent pickups: Load up on Jaguars
content: All of the free agent options worth adding as we dive into Week 17 and the fantasy football championships.

title: Bowl season best bets: How to beat the bad bets while still getting in on the fun
content: Bowl season could be the last chance to back some beloved underdogs -- here's how to do it with all the chaos.

title: Most fashionable arrivals of NFL Week 16, featuring George Kittle
content: Before the NFL's Saturday slate kicked off, players made sure to put their most fashionable foot forward.

title: Transfer window preview: What do Europe's big clubs need?
content: The transfer window is set to open across Europe in January, so what are the top clubs planning? Who comes in? Who will go?

title: Pickups: Raynaud, Landale among several quality center options
content: Every week in fantasy basketball, there are available players who can help fill holes in your roster. Here are the ones to add for the week ahead.

title: Epstein files: Trump's name appears in latest file drop; listed as passenger on 8 private jet flights
content: Newly released DOJ records include an internal email stating that Donald Trump was listed as a passenger on at least eight flights aboard Jeffrey Epstein’s private jet between 1993 and 1996. The email, written by an assistant US attorney, details occasions when Ghislaine Maxwell and members of Trump’s family were also listed as passengers, while noting specific flights involving Epstein and potential witnesses. The disclosure is part of a broader release of thousands of Epstein-related documents.

title: From ‘great friend Modi’ to 50% tariffs: Decoding India–US ties in the Trump era
content: India-US relations are currently characterized by unpredictable fluctuations, driven by transactional politics and personal ego, particularly under President Trump's administration. Despite past bonhomie, trade wars and differing stances on global conflicts have strained ties, creating a complex dynamic between strategic imperatives and political unease.

title: AI lies: Godfather of AI says he hides identity from chatbots; Here is the reason
content: AI godfather Yoshua Bengio revealed he must deceive chatbots to get honest feedback, as their programmed politeness leads to biased, overly optimistic responses. This 'sycophancy' is a significant flaw, causing AI to prioritize pleasing users over truth. Other experts echo this concern, noting AI's tendency to act as a 'yes man,' even misjudging situations where humans see wrongdoing.

title: VHT: Will Bumrah play in Vijay Hazare Trophy? Updates on Axar Patel too
content: The BCCI has exempted Jasprit Bumrah from the Vijay Hazare Trophy to manage his workload ahead of a busy white-ball season and the T20 World Cup. Despite asking other stars to play domestic cricket, Bumrah has been rested due to past injury concerns. Axar Patel and Ravindra Jadeja will feature in the tournament.

title: 'Taken where?': Last moments of Hindu man lynched in B’desh; how rumours cost family its breadwinner
content: A Hindu garment factory worker in Bangladesh was brutally lynched by a mob of around 140 people, allegedly for a blasphemous social media post. Investigators have found no evidence to support the accusation, yet the victim's family lives in fear. Twelve arrests have been made as authorities investigate the deliberate circulation of misinformation.

title: EC's SIR sweep: Nearly 43 lakh voters removed in Madhya Pradesh; Kerala sees over 24 lakh deletions
content: The Election Commission has released draft voter lists for Madhya Pradesh and Kerala, showing significant deletions. Madhya Pradesh removed over 42 lakh voters, including deceased, untraceable, and shifted residents. Kerala also deleted more than 24 lakh names for similar reasons, with final rolls to be published in February.

title: Salesforce reboots AI strategy: Model errors raise concerns
content: Salesforce is scaling back its reliance on large language models due to reliability issues, shifting focus to more predictable automation. Executives admit a decline in AI model trust, citing instances where agents missed instructions or lost focus. This move follows significant staff reductions attributed to AI deployment, as the company navigates the gap between AI hype and practical business needs.

title: PM Modi mourns Vinod Kumar Shukla; veteran Hindi writer dies at 89
content: Renowned Hindi writer and Jnanpith laureate Vinod Kumar Shukla passed away at 89. Celebrated for his simple yet profound style, Shukla's novels and poetry, including 'Deewar Mein Ek Khirkee Rehti Thi', deeply influenced modern Hindi literature. His unique narrative, blending everyday life with existential depth, leaves a lasting legacy of humanism and lyrical insight.

title: Merry Christmas 2025: Best messages, quotes, wishes and images to share on Christmas
content: Christmas is approaching. Families and friends will connect over food and company. The article offers messages, quotes, and images for sharing. These festive greetings aim to spread joy and warmth. They include wishes for a delightful holiday season. Famous quotes on Christmas are also provided. These offer timeless reflections on the spirit of Christmas.

title: Ashes 2025: 'Five or six days of drinking' — England players' behaviour set for review
content: England's cricket board will investigate claims of excessive player drinking during a mid-Ashes break in Noosa, Queensland. Managing director Rob Key stated that while he supports players switching off, heavy drinking is unacceptable.  He confirmed the matter would be looked into if reports of prolonged alcohol consumption prove accurate, emphasizing the need for professionalism.

title: Massive Netflix exit: Over 100 Originals to be removed in 2026; See which titles are going
content: Over 100 beloved Originals, including "Arrested Development" and "The Last Kingdom," are set to depart from Netflix in 2026 as licensing deals expire. This significant wave of removals impacts various genres, from animated series to international dramas, prompting concern among dedicated fans.

title: Akhlaq lynching case: Court rejects UP govt plea to withdraw charges against accused
content: A court in Gautam Buddha Nagar has dismissed the Uttar Pradesh government's plea to withdraw prosecution in the Akhlaq lynching case. The judge's decision was lauded by Akhlaq's lawyer, who stated that justice has been served to the family. The next hearing is scheduled for January 6th.

title: Matt Chapman & Taylor Chapman net worth 2025: MLB earnings and family wealth
content: San Francisco Giants' third baseman Matt Chapman is projected to earn approximately $26 million in salary in 2025, contributing to an estimated net worth of $53 million. While his wife, Taylor, is involved in fitness, her financial details are not publicly available, making Matt's earnings the primary driver of the family's financial picture.

title: US embassy, consulates in India to stay closed over Christmas period; routine services suspended
content: The US embassy in India will be closed from December 24 to December 26 due to a Presidential Executive Order mandating federal government closures. Routine consular services will be suspended, with only emergency assistance available for US citizens. Normal operations are set to resume on December 29.

title: 'Demands from everywhere': Vadra on Cong leader's Priyanka for PM pitch
content: Robert Vadra backed Congress MP Imran Masood’s push for Priyanka Gandhi as a potential PM face, saying there are demands from everywhere for her, and even for his own entry into politics, while stressing focus on real issues. Priyanka had flagged rising attacks on minorities in Bangladesh, where a Hindu youth’s lynching led to arrests and strong condemnation.

title: OTD: How Boycott overtook Sobers; became Test cricket's top run-scorer
content: On this day in 1981, England's Geoffrey Boycott shattered Garry Sobers' long-standing Test run-scoring record in Delhi. Needing 82, Boycott achieved his 22nd century, reaching 8,037 runs. This milestone marked a significant moment before his subsequent, abrupt retirement from the game.

title: Jaxson Dart’s lucky diamond necklace breaks during 13–16 loss to Vikings
content: New York Giants quarterback Jaxson Dart's cherished heart-studded diamond necklace, a symbol of his sister and spreading love, broke during a recent game. This sentimental good-luck charm, worn since college and surviving many hits, was lost mid-game, prompting commentary on its significance. Dart previously shared its deep personal value, emphasizing meaningful connections over material possessions.

title: 'I ran to save my life': UK-based singer Charles Antony recalls chaos at Messi event in Kolkata
content: London-based singer Charles Antony described his harrowing experience at Lionel Messi's G.O.A.T Tour event in Kolkata, where chaos erupted and he feared for his life. Antony, who had composed a special song for Messi, was forced to flee amid a stampede of angry fans unable to see the football star.

title: NMC invites applications for new medical colleges and MBBS seat expansion for 2026-27
content: The National Medical Commission has opened online applications for new MBBS colleges and increased UG seat intake for the 2026-27 academic year. The application window is from December 29, 2025, to January 28, 2026. Revised fees and substantial bank guarantees are now required, with a temporary relaxation on the seat cap.

title: Not just Call of Duty: How Vince Zampella changed first-person shooter video games
content: Zampella’s defining contribution was not graphical fidelity or technical ambition. It was mood. He understood that tension lives in restraint, that immersion deepens when players hesitate, and that fear is most effective when it feels earned rather than theatrical.

title: Magnesium and dementia risk: What happens to your brain when you take magnesium daily
content: New research suggests that increasing magnesium intake could significantly benefit brain health and potentially lower dementia risk. Studies indicate higher magnesium levels are linked to larger brain volume and fewer lesions, suggesting a younger-looking brain. Incorporating magnesium-rich foods like leafy greens, nuts, and seeds is recommended for optimal cognitive function as we age.

title: Virat Kohli just 1 run away from history; check his Vijay Hazare numbers
content: Virat Kohli is set to grace the Vijay Hazare Trophy after a 15-year hiatus, featuring for Delhi under Rishabh Pant. This move, aligning with BCCI directives, offers crucial preparation for the upcoming New Zealand ODI series.  Kohli, on the cusp of 16,000 List A runs, brings formidable recent ODI form to the domestic stage.

title: Ranveer Singh exits Don 3 amid Dhurandhar’s blockbuster run: Reports
content: Ranveer Singh exits 'Don 3' amid 'Dhurandhar's blockbuster run, eyeing Rs 700cr nett. Post-success, he skips back-to-back gangster roles, fast-tracks zombie thriller 'Pralay' with Jai Mehta. 'Don 3' makers hunt new lead; Kriti Sanon confirmed, Europe shoot by Jan 2026.

title: 'Prisoners for Palestine’: Greta Thunberg arrested by UK police during protest; detained under terrorism act
content: Greta Thunberg was reportedly detained by British police in London on Tuesday during a pro-Palestinian demonstration. The climate activist was allegedly arrested under the Terrorism Act while participating in a protest outside Aspen Insurance's offices. Police have not yet confirmed the details of the incident.

title: 'Don’t have next generation': Polgár, Rapport and changing faces of Hungarian chess
content: Hungary’s rich chess legacy, built by legends like Lajos Portisch, Judit Polgár and Peter Lékó, has thinned in recent years. Country's top-ranked player Richárd Rapport remains the lone elite standard-bearer after the 2014 Olympiad silver. He cites a lack of institutional support and fading continuity, but hopes leadership and reform can revive Hungarian chess’s former glory.

title: Two dates, three traps: How to fix your NPS, PAN and ITR before Dec 31
content: December brings crucial financial deadlines. Ensure your NPS Scheme A is switched by the 25th to avoid unwanted changes. The 31st marks the final chance for belated or revised tax returns, crucial for carrying forward losses. Also, verify Aadhaar-PAN compliance for specific PAN holders to prevent inoperability. These actions prevent future financial headaches.

title: Travis Kelce makes Taylor Swift swoon as Eras Tour doc ends emotionally
content: Taylor Swift’s Eras Tour documentary ends on a deeply personal note, highlighting a handwritten message from Travis Kelce revealed before her final shows. The letter left the pop star emotional, as she reflected on their fairy-tale love story, its growth, and the emotional weight of closing a historic tour. It reminded fans that behind the record-breaking success was a very human journey.

title: More Indians are applying for jobs in 2025, says data: Is the job market keeping pace?
content: India’s job market in 2025 reflected movement rather than momentum. Apna.co’s India at Work 2025 report shows job applications rising 29 per cent to over 9 crore, driven by women and freshers. Hiring expanded beyond metros, led by SMBs, while competition intensified amid steady, not dramatic, job creation.

title: PCB chief Naqvi to lodge formal complaint against India U19 boys
content: Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) plans to complain to the ICC over Indian Under-19 players’ conduct during the Under-19 Asia Cup 2025 final. PCB chief Mohsin Naqvi and mentor Sarfaraz Ahmed accused Indian players of provocation and acting against cricket’s spirit. Pakistan won the final by 191 runs, claiming their second U19 Asia Cup title.

title: 'Is this AI?': JD Vance's photos training with Navy SEALs has netizens shocked
content: Vice President JD Vance recently underwent rigorous training with U.S. Navy SEALs in California. Photos show him participating in demanding exercises like carrying logs and climbing obstacle courses. The 41-year-old veteran completed a 90-minute workout, leaving him feeling exhausted. The images have circulated online, drawing praise for his strength and endurance from the public. Read here to know more!

title: Electoral might: BJP shows Rs 6,900cr bank balance, BSP an astounding 580cr; Cong Rs 53cr
content: Post-Delhi assembly election disclosures to the Election Commission show BJP holding over Rs 6,900 crore in bank balances, far ahead of rival parties. Congress has about Rs 53 crore, while the BSP holds Rs 580 crore despite limited presence. Congress had reported Rs 517 crore in large donations in 2024–25.

title: Exclusive: Gill to play in Vijay Hazare Trophy; Ranji Trophy appearance on the cards too
content: Shubman Gill will represent Punjab in two Vijay Hazare Trophy fixtures on January 3 and 6 before joining the ODI squad against New Zealand. He has also expressed his desire to participate in the remaining Ranji Trophy matches for Punjab. This domestic stint precedes his involvement in the IPL, having been axed from the T20I World Cup squad.

title: Paul Rudd reacts to Travis Kelce’s emotional apology after Chiefs loss
content: Actor Paul Rudd shared his perspective on the Kansas City Chiefs' season. He highlighted the joy and memories the team has provided his family. Rudd embraced the team's elimination from playoff contention. He wished Patrick Mahomes a speedy recovery. Rudd also humorously suggested players deserved a break after a long season. He stated he was not too upset.

title: Assault over 'tu': Doctor suspended for hitting patient in Shimla hospital
content: A doctor at Shimla's IGMC was suspended after a video showed him brutally assaulting a patient who objected to being addressed disrespectfully. The patient alleged the doctor began punching him after he asked for politeness. An inquiry is underway, with authorities promising exemplary action against the involved medical staff.

title: Watch: Moment 'Call Of Duty' creator’s Ferrari crashes in California; bursts in flame
content: Call of Duty co-creator Vince Zampella tragically died in a high-speed Ferrari crash on Sunday. Disturbing video footage of the final moments before the fatal accident has surfaced online, sparking widespread shock and concern. Zampella, a visionary game developer, co-founded Infinity Ward and Respawn Entertainment, leaving an indelible mark on the gaming industry.

title: Moon impact alert: scientists track asteroid 2024 YR4 and its potential effects
content: Astronomers are closely watching asteroid 2024 YR4. This space rock may hit the Moon in December 2032. The impact could be visible from Earth. It could also send debris towards Earth. This poses a risk to satellites and future human missions. The James Webb Space Telescope will provide more data. Scientists are monitoring the skies for safety.

title: World record: Five wickets in an over! Indonesia bowler scripts T20I history
content: History was etched in T20 Internationals as Indonesian pacer Gede Priandana achieved an unprecedented feat, claiming five wickets in a single over during the match against Cambodia. This remarkable performance, which included a hat-trick, saw Cambodia collapse and secured a significant victory for Indonesia. Priandana's achievement surpasses previous records held by renowned bowlers.

title: Naidu unveils South India Rocketry Challenge–2026 poster
content: The initiative aimed at nurturing rocket-making skills among school and college students across the region

title: Centre asks States to hold special gram sabhas for awareness on VB-G RAM G
content: In letter to States and Union Territories, the Centre has asked that these meetings be held by December 26 with the active participation of workers, women, SC/ST households, and vulnerable groups

title: Nothing special about DCM’s Delhi visit, says Karnataka Minister
content: The Minister says he hopes the party high command will end the confusion about the change of leadership in the State

title: PODA piloted by Kerala Police focuses on corporate-led drug prevention
content: Survey reveals very high drug consumption among financially stable youth in the age group of 25-35 in Kerala

title: Telangana conducts first State-level mock exercise on floods and industrial disasters
content: Large-scale exercise organised in response to climate-related challenges, including sudden heavy rainfall and flash floods, as well as a series of industrial accidents in recent years

title: Entries open for The Hindu Margazhi Music Contest
content: To enter the contest, participants should submit a video of their performance at https://newsth.live/margazhi2025 or scan the QR code

title: Six arrested for honour killing; protests staged in Hubballi, Kalaburagi
content: The Dharwad District Police are making efforts to trace the remaining nine accused in the case, while nine victims are recovering in hospital

title: TGSRTC connects city suburbs, mofussil areas with IT Corridor
content: New routes designed to reduce travel time and improve last-mile connectivity, according to TGSRTC Hyderabad Region Manager Sudha Parimala

title: Close to two lakh entries under ASD list in Kozhikode’s draft electoral roll
content: As many as 26,58,847 enumeration forms were distributed in the district as part of the SIR; a total of 1,86,179 voters were found to be dead, untraceable/absent, permanently shifted, or having duplicate names

title: Irinjalakuda to host Varnakkuda cultural festival from December 26
content: The maiden Innocent memorial award to be presented to actor Tovino Thomas; P. Jayachandran memorial award for singer Harishankar; writer Anand to receive people’s tribute

title: Andhra Pradesh targets pothole-free roads by January-end: Minister
content: ₹3,000 crore sanctioned for repair and development of over 10,000 km of roads; two-wheelers, autos and tractors to be exempt from proposed tolls, he says

title: Over 24 lakh voters out of draft electoral roll in Kerala after SIR
content: In all, 24,08,503 voters are in the Absent, Shifted, Dead (ASD) list published alongside the draft rolls. Of this, 6,45,548 are listed as ‘untraceable/absent,’  8,16,221 as ‘permanently shifted,’ while 1,60,830, are in the ‘others’ category.

title: Sabarimala gold theft: Bellary-based jeweller moves Kerala HC seeking bail
content: He is charged with misappropriating 474 gm of gold from the gold-plated copper coverings of the Dwarapalaka idols

title: Chairperson’s post to be shared in Maradu municipality
content: Ajitha Nandakumar and Suneela Sibi will serve as chairperson in turns, each for two and a half years, while Congress councillors Jinson Peter and P.P. Santhosh will share the vice chairperson post for a specified period

title: Centre assures duty hike on titanium dioxide
content: Following a high-level meeting led by MPs N.K. Premachandran and K. Radhakrishnan with Union Ministers Nirmala Sitharaman and Piyush Goyal, the Centre agreed to consider reinstating anti-dumping duty along with increasing import duty

title: Unified Family Survey launched to update household records in Andhra Pradesh
content: Door-to-door exercise seeks to ensure no eligible family is left out of welfare schemes, enhance service delivery, and streamline certificate issuance through updated digital data

title: Kerala govt. suspends Prisons DIG on corruption charges
content: The VACB’s FIR accuses M.K. Vinod Kumar of seeking sizeable backhanders from relatives of convicts for facilitating their parole

title: Day-care bone marrow transplant performed at private hospital
content: It highlights the potential for shorter treatment duration and reduced costs for select blood cancer patients

title: Four new waste-to-energy plants to come up in Andhra Pradesh, taking total to six
content: MoUs signed for projects at Nellore, Kakinada, Kadapa and Kurnool, with 57 MW capacity, as the State accelerates conversion of municipal waste into electricity under the PPP model

title: Rajanna blames DCM for Congress losing LS seats to ‘vote theft’ in Karnataka
content: In a letter to Rahul Gandhi, last month that has come to the public domain now, the ex-Minister says Congress could have won 8 to 10 additional LS seats if ‘vote theft’ had been prevented

title: In a blow to poultry farmers, bird flu detected in Kottayam, Alappuzha districts
content: The infection has been confirmed in one ward each of eight panchayats in Alappuzha and in four villages in Kottayam. In Alappuzha, 19,881 birds within the one-km radius of epicentres will  be culled and around 5,000 birds in Kottayam. Culling will begin on December 26

title: Hung verdict delays finalisation of key posts in Eloor municipality
content: LDF, with 15 seats in the 32-member civic body, is expected to announce its chairperson and deputy chairperson picks on December 24; UDF, with 12 seats, is unlikely to field candidates; NDA, with five seats, is set to finalise its strategy the same day

title: Critical minerals key to national security: Air Marshal Dixit
content: Air Marshal Ashutosh Dixit said that global supply networks for critical minerals are highly concentrated and increasingly subject to export controls and geopolitical pressures

title: Krishnadevaraya-era inscription offers earliest epigraphical evidence of Bonalu festival in Telangana
content: The inscription, originally discovered at Gobbur, a border area between Telangana and Karnataka, is currently housed in the State Archaeology Museum, Hyderabad

title: Draft electoral rolls published in Kottayam and Pathanamthitta
content: As many as 98, 344 and  1,61,262 voters have been dropped from the list in Pathanamthitta and Kottayam respectively

title: Centre diluting environmental protection laws, alleges Prashant Bhushan
content: Senior Supreme Court advocate emphasises the need for people to realise the dangers involved and unite to raise their voice against such policy changes

title: BJP’s ‘Beti Bachao’ slogan rings hollow amid Ankita Bhandari murder case revelations: Congress
content: Congress’s Uttarakhand chief Ganesh Godiyal says the BJP’s claims of safeguarding women stand exposed

title: MEDISEP Phase II launch on January 1, with increased premium, coverage
content: A section of government staff says that the premium hike is unreasonable as many prominent hospitals have not been empanelled.  The Oriental Insurance company sustained significant losses in Phase I, approving medical claims of ₹1,724 crore when the premium paid to it was ₹1,461 crore

title: 40th Asian Waterbird Census on January 10, 11 in Godavari estuary
content: The census to focus on presence of Indian Skimmer, Great Knot, Eurasian Curlew, Eurasian oystercatcher at Godavari estuary, one of the prominent sites where Indian Skimmer and Great Knot can be sighted together in India

title: MVD bid to rein in rash driving by delivery boys of e-commerce platforms
content: Notices issued to delivery representatives of Blinkit, Swiggy, Zepto, Bigbasket etc., following rise in traffic violations by delivery boys of these firms

title: Good response to ‘Porunai Archaeological Museum’ as over 1,600 visitors visit on day one
content: The visitors gratefully recalled the archaeologists who put in their tireless efforts in excavating the artefacts of Adichanallur, Sivakalai, Korkai and Thulukkarpatti

title: Bombay HC tells Vijay Mallya to return to India before challenging Fugitive Offenders law
content: Ruling that the constitutional validity plea cannot be heard in absentia, HC asks Mr. Mallya to file an affidavit with a timeline for his return; S-G Mehta says extradition proceedings should not be stalled by such pleas

title: Dalit organisations demand special law against honour killing
content: They are making the demand following the honour killing at Inam Veerapur in Hubballi taluk in which a pregnant woman lost her life

title: KCCI to plant 5,000 saplings during Green Initiative Year
content: The Karnatak Chamber of Commerce and Industry will issue Green Certificates to guests visiting the chamber

title: Internet services suspended in two violence-hit Karbi Anglong districts in Assam
content: Home and Political Department said in the interest of maintaining greater public peace and tranquility, and to prevent any deterioration of the present situation, internet services have been temporarily suspended

title: RBI data shows robust industrial growth in A.P. in 2019-24, contradicts TDP–JSP charges, says Jagan
content: During YSRCP regime, the State stood first in South India and eighth in the country in overall industry sector growth, claims former CM

title: Unorganised workers too will get ESIC medical services, says Shobha
content: The Union Minister of State says free hospital services will be available for agricultural, contract and garment workers from unorganised sector

title: "Pattern Of Persecution": Canadian MP On Hindu Man's Lynching In Bangladesh
content: Canadian MP Shuv Majumdar has called for an end to the "pogroms" against minorities in Bangladesh, demanding the Chief Adviser of Bangladesh, Muhammad Yunus for accountability.

title: No Snowfall At A Time Kedarnath Usually Sees 5-8 Feet Snow
content: At a time when Kedarnath in Uttarakhand is usually covered in at least five feet of snow,the hill shrine till Tuesday did not witness any snowfall, raising an alarm among environmentalists.

title: BJP, AIADMK Begin Seat-Sharing Talks Ahead Of Tamil Nadu Polls
content: BJP leader and Union Minister Piyush Goyal on Tuesday formally commenced seat-sharing talks with the AIADMK, marking a key development in alliance-building ahead of the 2026 Tamil Nadu Assembly elections.

title: 'No PUC, No Fuel' Rule To Stay In Delhi Even After GRAP-IV Ends: Minister
content: The Delhi government will continue its 'No PUC, No fuel' policy for vehicles even after the GRAP-IV restrictions end, Environment Minister Manjinder Singh Sirsa said on Tuesday.

title: "We're Biggest Fugitives Of India": Lalit Modi, Vijay Mallya's New Video
content: Lalit Modi on Monday appeared to take a swipe at India when he shared a video from Vijay Mallya's birthday party, where he referred to himself and Mallya as the two "biggest fugitives".

title: UP Man Hits Wife, 4-Year-Old Son With Hot Tava Over Delay In Serving Roti
content: A man allegedly assaulted his wife and four-year-old son with a hot iron griddle (tawa) following an argument over delay in making roti in Gorakhpur, police said on Tuesday.

title: Gold Price Surges Rs 2,650 To Record Rs 1.4 Lakh Per 10 Gram
content: Gold prices stayed in ascending order for the second straight day, climbing Rs 2,650 to a fresh peak of Rs 1,40,850 per 10 grams in the national capital on Tuesday.

title: Jnanpith Awardee Hindi Author Vinod Kumar Shukla Dies At 89
content: Eminent Chhattisgarh-based Hindi writer and Jnanpith Award recipient Vinod Kumar Shukla died on Tuesday evening due to age-related ailments at a government hospital here, his family members said.

title: Video: Madhya Pradesh Minister Finds New Road Crumbling Under Her Feet
content: During a Sunday inspection of Madhya Pradesh's Raigaon constituency, state minister Pratima Bagri slammed the Public Works Department (PWD) after a newly renovated road crumbled beneath her feet.

title: 'Don't Object To India Action If...' Pak Leader Slams Own Country Over Kabul
content: A Pakistani lawmaker has called out the hypocrisy of his country's leadership, drawing a parallel between Islamabad's military actions against Kabul and India's 'Operation Sindoor'.

title: For Mumbai Civic Polls, BJP Ups Eknath Shinde's Seat Offer To 90, He Wants 20 More
content: The tussle over seat sharing for the BMC election continues in the Mahayuti camp, with the BJP coming up with a fresh formula that gives Eknath Shinde's Shiv Sena more seats than its initial offer but is nowhere close to the party's wishlist.

title: No Camera, Only Keypads: Rajasthan Villages Restrict Women's Phone Use
content: A decision taken by a local Panchayat in Rajasthan's Jalore district has triggered widespread criticism. The Sundhamaata Patti Panchayat of the Chaudhari community has announced a ban on smartphones with cameras for women across 15 villages.

title: As Bangladesh Slides Into Chaos, Yunus Government Rakes Up Anti-India Plank
content: As Bangladesh descends into chaos, the interim government's Chief Adviser Muhammad Yunus is now facing criticism at home.

title: Turning Pages, Not Screens: Tamil Nadu Man's Scooter Library Sparks A Reading Revival
content: At a time when most people are addicted to mobile phones and reading is on the decline, a post graduate in Tamil Nadu's Thoothukudi is nurturing reading in a unique way.

title: Adani Group's Clean Energy Units See Milestone Year, Solar, Wind, Green Hydrogen Scale Up
content: The Adani Group's solar, wind and green hydrogen businesses posted a breakout year in 2025, delivering record scale, technology advances and first-of-its-kind projects that underscored the conglomerate's growing role in the global energy transition.

title: 13 Get Life For Killing Father And Son During Waqf Act Violence In Bengal
content: A court in West Bengal's Murshidabad district on Tuesday sentenced 13 people to life imprisonment for the lynching of a man and his son during the protests over the Waqf (Amendment) Act in April.

title: "Missiles Not Far Away": Pak Leader Provokes India Over Bangladesh's Sovereignty
content: A senior youth leader from Pakistan's ruling party has issued a sharp warning to India, invoking military retaliation if Bangladesh's sovereignty is threatened.

title: Envoys Summoned, Visa Services Shut: Bangladesh-India Ties Nosedive
content: Bangladesh on Tuesday summoned the top Indian envoy as fresh protests erupted outside its high commission in New Delhi over the mob lynching of a Hindu worker in Dhaka.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Ain't No Mountain High Enough ... To Keep Them From Getting To Aravallis
content: A technical redefinition threatens to turn one of India's oldest mountain ranges into legally exploitable land. But even by the government's own standards, four questions remain unanswered.

title: Greta Thunberg Arrested At 'Prisoners For Palestine' Protest In London
content: London police on Tuesday arrested Swedish activist Greta Thunberg at a demonstration in support of pro-Palestinian hunger strikers, Palestinian activist groups said.

title: Wetzel: Is this the last straw for NCAA enforcement?
content: Jeremy Pruitt coached the Vols from 2018 to '20 . he was fired after the school uncovered recruiting violations . in 2023, the NCAA's committee on infractions concluded the program committed 18 Level I violations - mostly related to paying prospects and their families .

title: Transfer portal: Tracking who intends to move
content: College football's transfer portal officially opens at midnight ET on Jan. 2. However, players have been announcing their intentions to transfer since the regular season ended. Once the portal opens, players have until Jan. 16 to enter their name to transfer. It doesn't mean they have to find their new schools by then -- or that they can't return to their previous schools. We are tracking the notable players entering the portal as well as those players who will re-sign with their current schools. Here's the latest news and updates on how the 2026 season could be transformed.

title: 2026 NFL Pro Bowl AFC, NFC rosters: The league's top players
content: the rosters are set for the 2026 NFL Pro Bowl Games . the Baltimore Ravens, Denver Broncos , San Francisco 49ers and Seattle Seahawks lead the way with six players chosen . this year's games include a skills competition and a 7-on-7 flag football game scheduled for Feb. 3 .

title: What has gone wrong for four teams trying to make the playoffs?
content: the Lions, Chargers and Bills all clinched with the Colts' loss . we entered the slate with two guaranteed playoff teams, and we leave it with 10 . this column comes to you every Tuesday, though, as we reset our content .

title: The budding Spurs-Thunder rivalry that could shape the future of the West
content: wemby believes he's the best overall player in the league . the defending champions had snapped their 16-game winning streak in the most high-stakes game of the season . wembanyama has had a frosty competitive relationship with 'chet Holmgren' .

title: 🤔 Ranking every CFB coaching hire
content: former Nebraska quarterback Scott Frost returned to Lincoln to save a flailing cornhuskers program . he went 16-31 and was fired early in his fifth season . former Ohio State player and longtime Buckeyes assistant Luke Fickell took the Wisconsin head coaching job .
